CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Georgios A. Serghides;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . He was employed by “ Betonjerka”- ORG , a socially - owned company based in PERSON ( hereinafter “ the debtor ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ordered the debtor to pay the applicant specified amounts on account of salary arrears and social insurance contributions , plus the costs of the civil proceedings . On DATE this judgment became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE upon the applicant ’s request to that effect , ORG ordered the enforcement of the said judgment and further ordered the debtor to pay the applicant the enforcement costs .

CARDINAL . The Government in its observations maintained that the said judgment had been fully enforced by the domestic decisions of DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE respectively . The applicant did not contest this submission .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ordered the debtor to pay the applicant other specified amounts on account of salary arrears and social insurance contributions . In addition the domestic court ordered each party to pay its own costs of the civil proceedings . This judgment became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE upon the applicant ’s request to that effect , ORG ordered the enforcement of the said judgment and further ordered the debtor to pay the applicant the enforcement costs .
CARDINAL . The said decision remains unenforced to the present date .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG opened insolvency proceedings in respect of the debtor .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon a submission to that effect , ORG recognized the applicant ’s respective claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the insolvency proceedings against the debtor , having decided to continue with the insolvency action against the debtor ’s estate .
CARDINAL . The insolvency proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional appeal complaining firstly about the fairness of the insolvency proceedings . Further , he requested ORG to adopt a decision obliging the respondent ORG to pay from its own funds his unpaid salaries . In particular , the applicant had referred only to the judgment which had been adopted in his favour on DATE . In so doing , the applicant also relied on the ORG ’s case - law related to the non - enforcement of domestic court decision rendered against socially - owned companies in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal finding that it is not vested with the power of the insolvency court to enable the payments of the claims recognized in the insolvency proceedings .
